citation.article-title: Stenotrophomonas chelatiphaga sp. nov., a new aerobic EDTA-degrading bacterium

p.s: Description of S. chelatiphaga sp. nov.
S. chelatiphaga (che.la’ ti.pha’ga Gr.n. chele claw; N.L. v. chelato to form clawlike complexes with cations, i.e. to chelate; Gr. v. phagein to eat; N.L. adj. chelatiphaga chelates eating).
Gram-negative rods, 0.5–0×0.8–1.3 μm in size, occurred singly or in pairs, and multiplied by binary fission.
Cells are motile by a single polar flagellum.
Colonies are white on mineral salts/EDTA agar (0.1–0.3 mm in diameter) and yellowish on trypticase soy agar (2–3 mm in diameter).
Able to grow at 25–40 °C, at pH 5.5–9.5 and optimally at 28–37 °C, at pH 6.5–8.5.
Catalase-, oxidase- and β-galactosidase-positive but urease and lipase-negative.
Hydrolyse starch and gelatin, but not Tween 80.
Do not reduce nitrate to nitrite, but produce indole from tryptophan.
Unable to grow at NaCl concentration above 2.5% (w/v).
Utilizable carbon sources are EDTA, d-glucose, d-fructose, galactose, d-mannose, maltose, l-arabinose, d-xylose, sorbitol, pyruvate, malate, citrate, acetate succinate.
The prevailing cellular fatty acids are C15:0iso, C15:0anteiso, C14:0, C16:1ω7c.
Dominant phospholipids are phosphatidylethanolamine, phosphatidylglycerol and diphosphatidylglycerol (cardiolipin).
Resistant to oxacillin, ampicillin, novobiocin, neomycin, streptomycin and nalidixic acid, but sensitive to kanamycin, gentamycin and lincomycin.
The DNA G+C content is 68.3 mol% (Tm).
The type strain, LPM-5T (=VKM B-2486T=DSM 21508=CCUG 57178) was isolated from municipal sewage sludge sampled near Kazan city (Tatarstan, Russian Federation).
